headline: Gillette attempts to score points with social justice warriors in new ad on toxic masculinity
subHeadline: Guests: Katherine Timpf, George "Tyrus" Murdoch, Pete Hegseth, Heather Zumarraga

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: All right, just another slow week in Trumpville. Let's start with the meal that made the media squeal.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We have pizzas. We have 300 hamburgers, many, many French fries.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Many, many French fries. That seems like a year ago, but the media lost their lunch over this, enraged at Trump for serving food everyone on Earth loves to eat. Think about it? How many times have you had to go to some formal event and plan what you're going to eat after you eat? Because the first dinner sucks. It's always like some tiny bird on a plate - all bones and veins. It's like you're eating an old lady's fist. Trump's been there many times. He thought, "Hey, what would I eat after I ate?" Of course, burgers and pizza. It's what we all want, yet people lost their minds. Mainly over this.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Do we have no food for you? Because we have a shutdown or do we give you some little quick salads that the First Lady will make along with Second Lady. They'll make some salads and I said you guys aren't into salads.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's true. Nobody is into salads. Nobody. I mean, has anyone ever on death row, ever asked for their last meal to be a chef salad? It's always burgers and pizza. Making it the gold standard for everyone, but CNN went for the sexist angle.

utterances.speaker: JOAN WALSH, POLITICAL ANALYST, CNN
utterances.sentences: That's appalling. It seems to me like the President will not be happy until there is not one single female Republican voter in the country. It's incredibly sexist. We aren't all here to make salads for men.

utterances.speaker: ERIN BURNETT, ANCHOR, CNN
utterances.sentences: This is one of those things where sometimes what people say when they're being funny exposes exactly who they are and what they think.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But wait, aren't they the ones conflating gender with salad? I'll have you know, ladies, I make a mean salad -- lettuce, tomatoes, onions -- of course, it's on top of a burger, but it's a salad, you pathetic, pathetic sexists. Disgusting.  Anyway, this media response again proves two things. The press will use anything to trash Trump and it's as if the trashing is always in lockstep, because it is. According to the Media Research Center, for Trump in 2018, coverage was 90% negative and for the second year in a row, Russia was the most covered Trump topic, which makes me think if space aliens landed on earth and proceeded to devour the human race, annihilating billions of innocent humans in a brutal rampage of mutilation and dismemberment, the surviving media would ask how does this affect the Mueller probe?   The media has been so screwed up since Trump that they even see white privilege among blacks.

utterances.speaker: AREVA MARTIN, ANALYST, CNN
utterances.sentences: That's a whole another long conversation about white privilege, the things that you have the privilege of doing that people of color don't have the privilege of.

utterances.speaker: DAVID WEBB, RADIO TALK SHOW HOST
utterances.sentences: How do I ask where village of white privilege?

utterances.speaker: MARTIN
utterances.sentences: David, by virtue of being a white male, you have white privilege.

utterances.speaker: WEBB
utterances.sentences: Areva, I hate to break it to you, but you should have been better prepped. I'm black.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, he's black? Yes, yes. It's like - holy crap, but the big news of the week, Nancy Pelosi a.k.a. the rich aunt who still gives you a lousy Christmas gift urges President Trump in a letter to deliver his State of the Union in writing. I bet he took that seriously. I wonder how he looked after reading her letter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Flea market. All right, so how did Trump respond to Nancy? He canceled her trip to Brussels 30 minutes - he only canceled flight, people will applaud. He actually wrote her a letter. It's priceless. In it, he says, "Due to the shutdown, I am sorry to inform you that your trip has been canceled." Yes, he's sorry. Somehow, I doubt that he's really sorry. I wonder how he felt when he dropped that letter in the mail.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Keep going. It's too perfect. Now, Trump canceled the trip, but it could have been worse. Think about it. He could have boarded the plane beforehand and filled it with fast food or he could have let it take off, then halfway there, rerouted it. Rerouted it to Mar-a-Lago and never tell Nancy, so as she steps off the aircraft, she's thinking, "Wow, Brussels looks a lot like Palm Beach." Or once they were ready to depart, announce that they're having a very special pilot flying this plane.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, so Nancy got off easy, but so did Donald. Think about it. Nancy's initial request just gave him the perfect excuse to get out of the worst thing ever, the State of the Union. It sucks. It's boring. It's dreadful. It's the ceremonial version of a colonoscopy and I know, I had one on Wednesday. Let's roll the tape.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sorry, wrong tape. Can we roll the tape of my colonoscopy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, one more time, can we see my colonoscopy?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How did Bruce Willis get in there? I hope he reads the card. Anyhow, old joke, the State of the Union takes place in D.C. which means if it happens, I have to go to D.C. and I don't want to go to D.C. To get to D.C., I have to take a train through Delaware and Baltimore first, which is like having sex with two goats in order to have sex with a mule.  So Nancy's letter gave Trump and me a golden ticket out of a nightmare. Trump should cancel the D.C. thing, get a large arena, a packet-full of fans have a great night. The press will have to cover it. After all, it's their job and it's going to be hilarious, and the Dems will feel compelled to respond with the same two miserable stiffs who together can merrily manage a pulse. It's too good to pass up. Imagine what Trump could come up with? It could be the greatest thing ever.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Tired of the same old boring State of the Union address featuring 45 minutes of soaring generalizations followed by 50% applause, 50% expressionless faces. Then get ready for President Trump's State of the Milky Way Galaxy Because It's The Best Galaxy Of All The Galaxies Address.  Live from the surface of Titan, Saturn's largest moon. Because Neptune was too low energy.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Boy, oh, boy, that's a low energy planet.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This isn't your Earthly State of the Union. No Congress. No Capitol. No problem. The usual crowds are not invited. But the media is invited. Why? Because it's face no one can hear the media whine about the President's Twitter feed, the President giving funny nicknames to his enemies.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Crying Chuck and Nancy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The President eating well-done steak. The President being aggressively honest.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We give billions and billions of dollars to these foreign countries that don't give a damn about us.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The President asking NATO to pay their fair share or any accomplishment in his first two years of office. Plus, there will be tons of Universe-changing announcements like how the new Space Force has already won the first contact war of 2027 against their evil space [bleep] from the Andromeda Galaxy. Or how he has turned the rings of Saturn into actual onion rings, with unlimited dipping sauce from Chick-Fil-A.   And of course how he plans to build a space wall around Earth and make the Martians pay for it. It's the State of the Milky Way Galaxy Because It's The Best Galaxy Of All The Galaxies Address.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. His dimples run as deep as his patriotism, "Fox and Friends" weekend co-hosts Pete Hegseth. She's so bright she saves money on lamps, stock market guru and financial analyst Heather Zumarraga. She is so sharp, her thoughts come with warning labels, "National Review" reporter, Kat Timpf. And he makes onions cry, former WWE Superstar and my massive sidekick and host of "UnPC" on Fox Nation, that's Tyrus.   GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, HOST: I make onions cry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, Pete, hasn't Pelosi handed Trump an amazing gift that he should take advantage of? PETE HEGSETH, CO-HOST "FOX AND FRIENDS": Yes, I first have to say that open was something special.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Truly. It was an amazing gift because - if it was conventional, what would happen? Trump would give an entire speech with Nancy Pelosi standing - seated behind him in the House Chamber. Who wants that? We wouldn't want any part of that. Now, he gets to pick his venue. See, they want to take him - here's the thing though, they want to take him out of the trappings of the Presidency. They don't want him to look like the President. That is their issue. That's why they don't want him in the House of Representatives.  Fine. Do it in the Senate. Where you would have Mike Pence and Mitch McConnell behind him or even better, forget her disingenuous speakership, disinvite all the Democrats, go to the border, right in front of the wall and say, "See these steel slats right here. This is what we need, America. And you know we need it. Let's do it."  I mean people would be receptive to that. Keep pounding. He's got the winning message. The question is, who blinks first and I don't think it has to be him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Interesting. What about you, Heather? What do you think? Obviously, no matter what he does, the media is going to trash him, as you could tell by the numbers, so ...

utterances.speaker: HEATHER ZUMARRAGA, STOCK MARKET GURU AND FINANCIAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Yes, they really do. I mean, I cover the economy quite often. The stock market was up again this week, the economy is doing very well, overall; unemployment, 50-year lows, wages are going up, over half of Americans view the economy as good or excellent, but you won't hear that on CNN or MSNBC.  I mean, they guy just can't get a win. It's not covered even the economic feats of deregulation and tax cuts, that's what really matters to the American people at the end of the day, is do I have a good job and can I pay my bills?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you know what matters to me? Fast food, Kat, fast food. You eat it. I've seen you eat it.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, REPORTER, NATIONAL REVIEW
utterances.sentences: I do eat it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's disgusting. You do it at your desk.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I do eat it. I often order from Posts Mates to get McDonald's delivered to my house, from a McDonald's that's maybe 250 feet away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. And you did what you believe to be a cookie just about five minutes ago.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I did and it was not a good cookie. I was disappointed in the quality of the cookie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: If I would have gone to this banquet and seen fast food, I would have been thrilled.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: It's the best food. I hate when people act like they're above fast food. Like what are you drinking some kale smoothie that tastes like chalk?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Come on? Everybody - the joy of McDonald's is incomparable, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I agree. I agree and it saves lives. It saves lives, I don't the stats --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: McDonald's?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Three out of five.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Three out five.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Three out of five lives saved.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Three out of five lives have been saved by McDonald's.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: That's what really matters to the American people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It does. There's nothing more American than the Golden Arches.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Amen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thoughts?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know those two people that died, they didn't try hard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They didn't eat enough McDonald's, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They took the apple slices, so they had to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know what, I - the biggest - the coolest thing this week, I actually enjoy the back and forth with Pelosi and President Trump. The problem is I just wish it wasn't during a government shutdown because you have some really great jokes there, but unfortunately, people were out of work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: People were out of work.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So it's not like, "Hey, man," but when she did it. When she says, 'Based on security which is like subliminal for, "Hey, Trump [bleep], you're not coming to my house tonight." She was a legend. She was Queen. Amazing, brilliant, thoughtful. Wow. He's like, "Okay, I raise your FU and I give you, you can't - I'll wait until you're on the bus. Bags packed. Shots given. You know, Pence was like, "Now, Mr. President?" "No, not yet. Not yet. Not yet."  The eye the sky was watching. They waited for her to put her headphones on and leaned back, and then there was a knock and it was a folded up, "This is for you." She was like, "What the [bleep]." That's exactly right. But, he was a monster. He ate a baby while - he actually wrote the letter with baby's blood. He was the worst human being in the planet.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Childish.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Childish, sexist. Acosta was a wreck. He had to write a whole new diss for him. I just think it's - the disparity, they're both doing it. They both have to say, "I respect it. We have the same problem. We both have the last word disease, so when we butt heads, no one will leave," because I know you are, I know you are - and that's what's going on with them. It's just too bad it's during a government shutdown because this is going to go for a long time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's highly entertaining.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They'll be out of office, both of them and still doing this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think he waited until she put the Ambien, like you know, when you take the Ambien and then it's like, no - and then you've got to wake up, but everything is screwed up and you're like, you don't know - I don't know where to go. Never take your Ambien before you board a plane because if the plane is delayed, you're wandering around the airport, you end up eating a four-pound bag of Toblerone, it's all over your face, you say something stupid, then you mistake a water fountain for a bathroom. These are things that I've done.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: They're too specific.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, the "Gutfeld Monologues Live" is coming to Florida for two shows in March and two more cities have been added to the tour because it's so successful. Washington, April 6th; Detroit, April 7th and in May, Stockton, Tulsa, Oklahoma, Dallas and Midlands, Texas. Tickets for all shows on sale now. Go to ggutfeld.com for ticket information. Up next, it's impeachment-itis and it's spreading more meltdowns you won't believe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "You must impeach," the haters beseech. "The Atlantic," a magazine, Pete, not the ocean has a cover story urging to start the Trump impeachment process because it will quote, "Rein in a President who is undermining American ideals and bring the debate about his fitness for office into Congress where it belong." If you say so "Atlantic," but I think you're selling Trump short. You think a little impeachment process is going to slow him down. Hell, no. If there's anything we've learned, antagonism is his fuel. He eats that [bleep] for breakfast. Impeachment to Trump is like spinach to Popeye. Three quick points why impeachment is lose-lose for the Libs. One, when they impeached Bill Clinton, it made him more popular than ever. America loves the underdog even if he's a dog. Number two, if you kick Trump out of office, that leaves us with Pence who is Conservative he makes Trump look like Mother Teresa and number three, if it succeeds, you still have Trump around who's folk hero status will make him bigger than Paul Bunyan and he's not going away, friends. So I say bring it on, because if it backfires, Dems will do this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'll never get tired of that. Tyrus, I think that the impeachment thing because you know Trump, whenever you feed him something that you think is going to hurt him, for some reason he like fashions it into a weapon and then fires it back at you. I think it's a win for - it would it reelect him.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Listen, this is just like if I was to assault a bunch of people and I got to pick my jury. You're going do time? "Yes, really not with my friends." The Senate is Republican, correct?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So you want to waste all of this? You know, I think he would eat it up. I think he would let the House go forward with it. He would get in the Senate and he wouldn't show up. He would be 45 minutes late, and then he would come in and he would he would make fun of some people and then he would like, "You all want to get ahead and vote?" "Well, Mr. President, we're going to give you ..." "No, let them vote." "Or you know what, talk amongst yourselves, let me know when they vote, I'll be back." There is nothing that the - the impeachment is never going to pass the Senate. The Republicans are not going to impeach him out, regardless of whatever you think he might have done, or what he's going to do, you're not going to get those votes. It's a complete waste of time. The only way you can get him out, and judging off those late night show things where they all declared for office, you've got to vote him out because he's not going to - it just - that's the only way it's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, and the thing is - that's the point, Kat, if they really want - we're two years into this. Just wait another two years, and then vote. I've said this before on a show called "The Five."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Never heard of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's interesting. Why not try to beat him instead of cheat him? Yes, thank you. Rhyming, a little tip, Kat?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: We're all clapping because Greg rhymes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes. Think about it, rhyming is fun.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I feel like he is not going to get impeached because everything is fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Am I the only person out there who thinks that everything's fine?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm there.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I mean, I wake up in the morning. I eat an egg sandwich. I run my mouth all day and then I go home and go to bed and I do it over again. It's fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I don't understand what they're seeing that I'm not seeing. It's not that I've loved every single thing he's ever said or done because I certainly haven't and I've been very open about that, but it seems as though there's no middle ground where you can just say, "Hey, you know what, I might not like this guy, maybe I won't vote for him," instead of saying, "We've got to get him out now because I don't like him and the world is going to end." I mean, I read this "Atlantic" piece and it made it - it seemed like we'd all been living in little mine caves eating beans out of a can.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Which, we're pretty much only doing if we want to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, in fact that's kind of similar to how you described your life except it's egg salad.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I love egg salad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who doesn't love egg salad?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I can't wait to be an old, old woman and just go around to deli shouting at someone when they're out of egg salad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That'll be in five years. Heather?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: He clearly despises President Trump. I think he wrote this article to doom re-election 2020 bid and I completely agree with Kat. Look, you vote him out if it - what did you say, "If you can't beat them ..."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cheat him.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you can't beat him, eat him. That's the cannibal wing of the party.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So now, he's going to get weird. It's going to get weird. This is going to get really weird right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is. I think it's weird.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.sentences: But 63 million Americans voted for him, so whether you like him or not, you can't delegitimize the election process and not liking him like you said is not good enough that's not - by itself, is not grounds for impeachment.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: I just don't know if they can get past it though. They can't focus on 2020 because they haven't gotten over 2016.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: And they don't believe he's legitimate in the first place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They can't enter a new relationship when they're still involved in an old one relationship.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Are you talking about the government or my ex-wife?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Isn't there already that ex out there and he's called Bob Mueller and he gets through - doesn't he get to decide?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he gets to decide.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.sentences: Waiting - are we waiting on this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I find it highly entertaining and if he - the thing is if this dog catches the car, the car is going to hit the dog. That's all I'm saying. All right, up next, by fingers what would happen if there was a female version of the Gillette male-bashing ad? We're going to show you even if you didn't ask for it.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT GRAY, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I am Robert Gray. More than 70 people are dead after a pipeline exploded at an illegal pipeline tap in Mexico. Nearly 100 people are missing and dozens injured. On Friday, hundreds gathered in a field near Mexico City to fill containers with gas, but were trapped in a massive inferno. Now, grief-stricken relatives watch as forensic experts separate burnt bodies. Mexico's new President has cracked down on fuel theft gangs that has caused widespread fuel shortages. New developments in the Flint, Michigan water crisis. Fifteen people have been charged after lead contamination sparked an outbreak of Legionnaires disease and other issues. Eight people are facing multiple charges including involuntary manslaughter. The crisis dates back to 2014 and has been linked to 12 deaths. Now back to "The Greg Gutfeld Show."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Should those who keep us shaven let your men on misbehaving, all right, by now you've probably seen that new Gillette ad that smears adult men in order to score some virtue points with the social justice mob and if you haven't seen the ad, don't say I didn't warn you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Bullying --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: The #MeToo Movement against sexual harassment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Toxic masculinity.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is the best a man can get? Is it? We can't hide from it. It's been going on far too long. We can't laugh at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That ad made a lot of good honest men feel like they'll never get credit for being good honest men, but I wonder could you even try and ad like that with women?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Is the best women can do? As feminists, shouldn't women get equal treatment, after all, fair is fair.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Gilette, do you think women are weak? You target men, but you spare us? That's just sexist.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So now, it's our turn. To confess our own bad behavior.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We forced men to watch terrible movies and we FaceTime our cat during it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh, does Jinx need to wee-wee. Does Jinx need to wee-wee.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And no matter the month, we won't stop telling you how cold we are.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Jeremy, I am so cold.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We believe in Astrology and date accordingly.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, Jim, I'm so flattered, but I actually don't date Capricorns, unless you're hot and in the NHL. Ivan, call me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We say we're not hungry and then we eat your food and complain about what you eat.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Are you going to order any food or --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'll just have some of yours. God, you eating like such an adolescent. Can you think, wow ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: But we swear to do better because if men want to improve, shouldn't we also. Nah, who are we kidding? We're not changing a thing. Because we don't have to and you're going to love us anyway because you love women. How can you not? We're awesome and so are men. Sure men have their flaws. Women have them, too. But to mistake the bad stuff with the whole, is simply a loser's game. Don't be a loser.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well done. Well done. All right, Heather, did you like the initial ad? Did you like the emotion or the meaning of it?

And of course how he plans to build a space wall around Earth and make the Martians pay for it. It's the State of the Milky Way Galaxy Because It's The Best Galaxy Of All The Galaxies Address.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guests. His dimples run as deep as his patriotism, "Fox and Friends" weekend co-hosts Pete Hegseth. She's so bright she saves money on lamps, stock market guru and financial analyst Heather Zumarraga. She is so sharp, her thoughts come with warning labels, "National Review" reporter, Kat Timpf. And he makes onions cry, former WWE Superstar and my massive sidekick and host of "UnPC" on Fox Nation, that's Tyrus. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, HOST: I make onions cry.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, Pete, hasn't Pelosi handed Trump an amazing gift that he should take advantage of? PETE HEGSETH, CO-HOST "FOX AND FRIENDS": Yes, I first have to say that open was something special.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Truly. It was an amazing gift because - if it was conventional, what would happen? Trump would give an entire speech with Nancy Pelosi standing - seated behind him in the House Chamber. Who wants that? We wouldn't want any part of that. Now, he gets to pick his venue. See, they want to take him - here's the thing though, they want to take him out of the trappings of the Presidency. They don't want him to look like the President. That is their issue. That's why they don't want him in the House of Representatives. Fine. Do it in the Senate. Where you would have Mike Pence and Mitch McConnell behind him or even better, forget her disingenuous speakership, disinvite all the Democrats, go to the border, right in front of the wall and say, "See these steel slats right here. This is what we need, America. And you know we need it. Let's do it." I mean people would be receptive to that. Keep pounding. He's got the winning message. The question is, who blinks first and I don't think it has to be him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Interesting. What about you, Heather? What do you think? Obviously, no matter what he does, the media is going to trash him, as you could tell by the numbers, so ...

utterances.speaker: HEATHER ZUMARRAGA, STOCK MARKET GURU AND FINANCIAL ANALYST
utterances.utterance: Yes, they really do. I mean, I cover the economy quite often. The stock market was up again this week, the economy is doing very well, overall; unemployment, 50-year lows, wages are going up, over half of Americans view the economy as good or excellent, but you won't hear that on CNN or MSNBC. I mean, they guy just can't get a win. It's not covered even the economic feats of deregulation and tax cuts, that's what really matters to the American people at the end of the day, is do I have a good job and can I pay my bills?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you know what matters to me? Fast food, Kat, fast food. You eat it. I've seen you eat it.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, REPORTER, NATIONAL REVIEW
utterances.utterance: I do eat it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's disgusting. You do it at your desk.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I do eat it. I often order from Posts Mates to get McDonald's delivered to my house, from a McDonald's that's maybe 250 feet away.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. And you did what you believe to be a cookie just about five minutes ago.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I did and it was not a good cookie. I was disappointed in the quality of the cookie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: If I would have gone to this banquet and seen fast food, I would have been thrilled.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: It's the best food. I hate when people act like they're above fast food. Like what are you drinking some kale smoothie that tastes like chalk?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Come on? Everybody - the joy of McDonald's is incomparable, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I agree. I agree and it saves lives. It saves lives, I don't the stats --

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: McDonald's?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Three out of five.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Three out five.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Three out of five lives saved.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Three out of five lives have been saved by McDonald's.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: That's what really matters to the American people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It does. There's nothing more American than the Golden Arches.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Amen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thoughts?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know those two people that died, they didn't try hard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They didn't eat enough McDonald's, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They took the apple slices, so they had to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know what, I - the biggest - the coolest thing this week, I actually enjoy the back and forth with Pelosi and President Trump. The problem is I just wish it wasn't during a government shutdown because you have some really great jokes there, but unfortunately, people were out of work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: People were out of work.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So it's not like, "Hey, man," but when she did it. When she says, 'Based on security which is like subliminal for, "Hey, Trump [bleep], you're not coming to my house tonight." She was a legend. She was Queen. Amazing, brilliant, thoughtful. Wow. He's like, "Okay, I raise your FU and I give you, you can't - I'll wait until you're on the bus. Bags packed. Shots given. You know, Pence was like, "Now, Mr. President?" "No, not yet. Not yet. Not yet." The eye the sky was watching. They waited for her to put her headphones on and leaned back, and then there was a knock and it was a folded up, "This is for you." She was like, "What the [bleep]." That's exactly right. But, he was a monster. He ate a baby while - he actually wrote the letter with baby's blood. He was the worst human being in the planet.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Childish.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Childish, sexist. Acosta was a wreck. He had to write a whole new diss for him. I just think it's - the disparity, they're both doing it. They both have to say, "I respect it. We have the same problem. We both have the last word disease, so when we butt heads, no one will leave," because I know you are, I know you are - and that's what's going on with them. It's just too bad it's during a government shutdown because this is going to go for a long time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's highly entertaining.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They'll be out of office, both of them and still doing this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think he waited until she put the Ambien, like you know, when you take the Ambien and then it's like, no - and then you've got to wake up, but everything is screwed up and you're like, you don't know - I don't know where to go. Never take your Ambien before you board a plane because if the plane is delayed, you're wandering around the airport, you end up eating a four-pound bag of Toblerone, it's all over your face, you say something stupid, then you mistake a water fountain for a bathroom. These are things that I've done.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: They're too specific.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, the "Gutfeld Monologues Live" is coming to Florida for two shows in March and two more cities have been added to the tour because it's so successful. Washington, April 6th; Detroit, April 7th and in May, Stockton, Tulsa, Oklahoma, Dallas and Midlands, Texas. Tickets for all shows on sale now. Go to ggutfeld.com for ticket information. Up next, it's impeachment-itis and it's spreading more meltdowns you won't believe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "You must impeach," the haters beseech. "The Atlantic," a magazine, Pete, not the ocean has a cover story urging to start the Trump impeachment process because it will quote, "Rein in a President who is undermining American ideals and bring the debate about his fitness for office into Congress where it belong." If you say so "Atlantic," but I think you're selling Trump short. You think a little impeachment process is going to slow him down. Hell, no. If there's anything we've learned, antagonism is his fuel. He eats that [bleep] for breakfast. Impeachment to Trump is like spinach to Popeye. Three quick points why impeachment is lose-lose for the Libs. One, when they impeached Bill Clinton, it made him more popular than ever. America loves the underdog even if he's a dog. Number two, if you kick Trump out of office, that leaves us with Pence who is Conservative he makes Trump look like Mother Teresa and number three, if it succeeds, you still have Trump around who's folk hero status will make him bigger than Paul Bunyan and he's not going away, friends. So I say bring it on, because if it backfires, Dems will do this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'll never get tired of that. Tyrus, I think that the impeachment thing because you know Trump, whenever you feed him something that you think is going to hurt him, for some reason he like fashions it into a weapon and then fires it back at you. I think it's a win for - it would it reelect him.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Listen, this is just like if I was to assault a bunch of people and I got to pick my jury. You're going do time? "Yes, really not with my friends." The Senate is Republican, correct?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So you want to waste all of this? You know, I think he would eat it up. I think he would let the House go forward with it. He would get in the Senate and he wouldn't show up. He would be 45 minutes late, and then he would come in and he would he would make fun of some people and then he would like, "You all want to get ahead and vote?" "Well, Mr. President, we're going to give you ..." "No, let them vote." "Or you know what, talk amongst yourselves, let me know when they vote, I'll be back." There is nothing that the - the impeachment is never going to pass the Senate. The Republicans are not going to impeach him out, regardless of whatever you think he might have done, or what he's going to do, you're not going to get those votes. It's a complete waste of time. The only way you can get him out, and judging off those late night show things where they all declared for office, you've got to vote him out because he's not going to - it just - that's the only way it's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, and the thing is - that's the point, Kat, if they really want - we're two years into this. Just wait another two years, and then vote. I've said this before on a show called "The Five."

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Never heard of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's interesting. Why not try to beat him instead of cheat him? Yes, thank you. Rhyming, a little tip, Kat?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: We're all clapping because Greg rhymes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes. Think about it, rhyming is fun.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I feel like he is not going to get impeached because everything is fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Am I the only person out there who thinks that everything's fine?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm there.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I mean, I wake up in the morning. I eat an egg sandwich. I run my mouth all day and then I go home and go to bed and I do it over again. It's fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't understand what they're seeing that I'm not seeing. It's not that I've loved every single thing he's ever said or done because I certainly haven't and I've been very open about that, but it seems as though there's no middle ground where you can just say, "Hey, you know what, I might not like this guy, maybe I won't vote for him," instead of saying, "We've got to get him out now because I don't like him and the world is going to end." I mean, I read this "Atlantic" piece and it made it - it seemed like we'd all been living in little mine caves eating beans out of a can.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Which, we're pretty much only doing if we want to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, in fact that's kind of similar to how you described your life except it's egg salad.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I love egg salad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who doesn't love egg salad?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I can't wait to be an old, old woman and just go around to deli shouting at someone when they're out of egg salad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That'll be in five years. Heather?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: He clearly despises President Trump. I think he wrote this article to doom re-election 2020 bid and I completely agree with Kat. Look, you vote him out if it - what did you say, "If you can't beat them ..."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cheat him.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you can't beat him, eat him. That's the cannibal wing of the party.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So now, he's going to get weird. It's going to get weird. This is going to get really weird right now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is. I think it's weird.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: But 63 million Americans voted for him, so whether you like him or not, you can't delegitimize the election process and not liking him like you said is not good enough that's not - by itself, is not grounds for impeachment.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: I just don't know if they can get past it though. They can't focus on 2020 because they haven't gotten over 2016.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: And they don't believe he's legitimate in the first place.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They can't enter a new relationship when they're still involved in an old one relationship.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Are you talking about the government or my ex-wife?

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Isn't there already that ex out there and he's called Bob Mueller and he gets through - doesn't he get to decide?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, he gets to decide.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Waiting - are we waiting on this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I find it highly entertaining and if he - the thing is if this dog catches the car, the car is going to hit the dog. That's all I'm saying. All right, up next, by fingers what would happen if there was a female version of the Gillette male-bashing ad? We're going to show you even if you didn't ask for it.

utterances.speaker: ROBERT GRAY, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I am Robert Gray. More than 70 people are dead after a pipeline exploded at an illegal pipeline tap in Mexico. Nearly 100 people are missing and dozens injured. On Friday, hundreds gathered in a field near Mexico City to fill containers with gas, but were trapped in a massive inferno. Now, grief-stricken relatives watch as forensic experts separate burnt bodies. Mexico's new President has cracked down on fuel theft gangs that has caused widespread fuel shortages. New developments in the Flint, Michigan water crisis. Fifteen people have been charged after lead contamination sparked an outbreak of Legionnaires disease and other issues. Eight people are facing multiple charges including involuntary manslaughter. The crisis dates back to 2014 and has been linked to 12 deaths. Now back to "The Greg Gutfeld Show."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Should those who keep us shaven let your men on misbehaving, all right, by now you've probably seen that new Gillette ad that smears adult men in order to score some virtue points with the social justice mob and if you haven't seen the ad, don't say I didn't warn you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Bullying --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: The #MeToo Movement against sexual harassment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Toxic masculinity.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Is the best a man can get? Is it? We can't hide from it. It's been going on far too long. We can't laugh at all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That ad made a lot of good honest men feel like they'll never get credit for being good honest men, but I wonder could you even try and ad like that with women?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Is the best women can do? As feminists, shouldn't women get equal treatment, after all, fair is fair.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Gilette, do you think women are weak? You target men, but you spare us? That's just sexist.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: So now, it's our turn. To confess our own bad behavior.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We forced men to watch terrible movies and we FaceTime our cat during it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Oh, does Jinx need to wee-wee. Does Jinx need to wee-wee.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: And no matter the month, we won't stop telling you how cold we are.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Jeremy, I am so cold.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We believe in Astrology and date accordingly.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Oh, Jim, I'm so flattered, but I actually don't date Capricorns, unless you're hot and in the NHL. Ivan, call me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: We say we're not hungry and then we eat your food and complain about what you eat.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Are you going to order any food or --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I'll just have some of yours. God, you eating like such an adolescent. Can you think, wow ...

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: But we swear to do better because if men want to improve, shouldn't we also. Nah, who are we kidding? We're not changing a thing. Because we don't have to and you're going to love us anyway because you love women. How can you not? We're awesome and so are men. Sure men have their flaws. Women have them, too. But to mistake the bad stuff with the whole, is simply a loser's game. Don't be a loser.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well done. Well done. All right, Heather, did you like the initial ad? Did you like the emotion or the meaning of it?

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: I thought it was well done, whether you agree with their intentions or not. I appreciate the emotion behind the ad, but liberalism, I think it's so potent right now that a company is willing to alienate over 50% of their client base, so while their intentions may have been good, I think it's a very bad business decision.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, you know Pete I think it's a subset of liberalism, which is identity politics, which artificially pits genders against each other. I don't think you would ever had that commercial if it wasn't for the fact that we're pitting male against female, race against race, gender against gender. I don't think - I mean, the point of our commercials to say that we're not opposed, we complement each other. We are necessary to exist together.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Of course. I thought that ad was horrific. No, I was - I don't get triggered very easily these days because there's so much absurdity out there. But what it basically was saying men the - first of all, they build up a formula of who men are right and then second of all, they say if you are a man then you're toxic in the way you do it and if your kid is tough or rough or if you've - if you like females, you're bad. If you look back at the old Gillette ads, I don't know if you watched any - maybe you have them, they're amazing. Look at the guys, I'm like - the guy is successful. He's scoring a touchdown. He's being nice to his kids --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Could I show you? I have an old Gillette ad. Let's show that old Gillette ad, shall we friends?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It combines a deep cleaning body wash with three times the hydrators, a powerful against dry skin. You'll step out of the shower feeling like you can take on the world.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: That's not the ad I was referring to, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You see what that is? Oh, it make him sexually attractive, so she is like into him because he only uses the body wash.

utterances.speaker: HEGSETH
utterances.utterance: Maybe he smells good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I found it repulsive. I don't need to see that kind of human flesh, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You do and that's the whole reason why you focus on just the dude washing himself - rushing that commercial. You know what, I could get into trouble, but I've got a lot of attention because I threw a diss at them after I did the story. And then I did an internet post where I'm talking about them before they throw a shade, they're part of the tree and I posted a picture of the Gillette girls who are at a car racing show with Gillette on their butts. You know what I am saying? And like, clean up your own backyard before you tell us how to act like men. The best thing that they should do, it's a razor company so maybe talk about if you're hairy, try this razor. You know what I am saying? Like, but on top of that, their sexism is worse than the guys in that - and I'm barbecuing and I'll be damned if I'll have an open flame and my child's beating up another child. First of all, I wouldn't allow that anyways, but if we switch that out, if we would have had a bunch of women and watch the start - a bunch of women with aprons with cookies standing together going, "Girls will be girls." Hell to the no. Gillette would be gone in a minute, not to mention their pink razors for women are more expensive. Come on, ladies. Gillette needs to clean up --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And they are pink.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, and honestly, you know what's funny, the women use the men's razors most of the time and those of us in the wrestling business, Bobby Lashley, they used the pink ones all the time. He said it was more - oh, I am dropping down, it's all coming out, but my point was clean up your own yard if you're talking about yours, most men are good and what about irresponsible women? Where's the Kardashians in that commercial?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Telling me I've got to get filters and hair extensions and cosmetic surgery to be pretty and you can't be sexy unless you got likes. Come on, Kat, tell them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But Kat, what I found funny is that the media criticized men for responding to the ad that portrayed the misogyny of - as the norm, it's like - so once men started to go, "Oh, why you don't like it when men are being portrayed as misogynist?" Well, yes, kind of.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'm just completely confused how you think there's no ad telling women to be different.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There are probably many.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Welcome to the entire beauty and fitness industry. It's like your hair is not that shiny, you need this to make your hair more shiny like her hair. Your butt is too big. Your butt is too small. Oh, no that bras is gross. You can't wear that bra. No one is going to ever have sex with you if you wear that bra or like, you look so much prettier if you smile more. Smile more. Ew, not like that, your teeth aren't white enough. You've got to use these white like this lady. Notice how this lady, she's baking gluten free brownies for her kids before they go to school, do you do that for your kids? Are you [bleep] mom? Oh, yes, you're [bleep] mom. Oh, yes, you're not only [bleep] mom, but you're also fat. You look a little tired. You should put some concealer under those eyes. But those concealer, and you're old, you look old, this lotion - lotion - you need to lotion yourself and lotion your body so you don't start to look old and you need to own the hairspray because if your hair doesn't stay like that all day long ...

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: She ain't going to stop.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: ... it has to stay like that all day long.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: We might as well go into commercial.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You can't just have pretty hair in the morning, you've got to have pretty hair at night. It has got to last the whole day because you never know who's going to see. Do you know Susan from the county, she has really, really nice hair, and did you do yoga today? Did you exercise? Did you eat yogurt? Wait, no don't eat dairy. Don't eat dairy. Dairy is bad.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: She's not going to stop.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Don't eat dairy. Dairy is bad. Is your hair too short? Is it too long? Your nails are short? Are your nails too short? Are they so short? You're never going to find a boyfriend ...

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Go to commercial.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Let's glue. Let's glue things. Let's glue things at the tip of your nails and make you sit there like this for an hour like an idiot because you have to be good enough. Yes, no, women are never told anything that needs to be different, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Unfortunately, we're going to have to edit that entire segment out of the show.

utterances.speaker: ZUMARRAGA
utterances.utterance: She's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now, I'm convinced we need more commercials bashing men. All right, up next would you ingest the blood of young people just to stay young yourself? Sure. I do it already.
